I agree that the quality of YIFI's downloads could be better, but they are by no means "bad". If you want perfect A/V quality, then by all means go find a 6gb version and download it. I watch these movies on a 34 inch HDTV and besides some minor pixelation from time to time the video quality is fine. The Audio quality is a bit off but its watchable. Some of the quieter parts of the movie has to be turned up, and then you have to turn it down for the really loud parts but I don't mind doing that. The movie looks clean and downloads in less than 25 minutes so I'm happy.  I normally rent these movies on On-Demand and then Download them just so I can have more control over fast forward and rewind and what not so the fact that I am willing to watch this version over the On-Demand version speaks to the quality of the upload. If you want perfection for archival purposes then go find a 6 Gig copy that has 200 seeders and 150 Leechers and spend all day downloading it. Otherwise, leave YIFI alone. He hasn't really disappointed me yet. I'd be willing to have a slightly larger file for better sound, but it's nothing to whine about.
Thenks YIFY ;)
